messages.subject: Re: Taisho
messages.msgSnippet: ... of ... I m ... the ... would ... Ok, now that I m over my bemusement - Taisho means general . Anyone who was a general was a taisho . That s it.
messages.messageBody:
--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, "spraffaman" <channon43@...>
wrote:
>
> Hi, Does anyone know of the Taisho I believe he was the forerunner
of
> the samurai, if you have any information I would be very grateful
I'm
> particularly interested in the period around 1100/1300ad. Alos in
the
> 1970's a company clled Hinchecliffle produced white metal model
> fifurines of the Samurai and the Taisho, if you have any information
> of where I could obtain such a fugurine that is unconstucted I
would
> be very grateful. Email spraffaman@... . Thanks
>

Ok, now that I'm over my bemusement - "Taisho" means "general". Anyone
who was a general was a "taisho". That's it.

messages.subject: Taisho
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, Does anyone know of the Taisho I believe he was the forerunner of the samurai, if you have any information I would be very grateful I m particularly
messages.messageBody:
Hi, Does anyone know of the Taisho I believe he was the forerunner of
the samurai, if you have any information I would be very grateful I'm
particularly interested in the period around 1100/1300ad. Alos in the
1970's a company clled Hinchecliffle produced white metal model
fifurines of the Samurai and the Taisho, if you have any information
of where I could obtain such a fugurine that is unconstucted I would
be very grateful. Email spraffaman@... . Thanks
